weight.description: Task's weight. Note that the trajectory task tends to severely constrain the robot motion and may significantly interfere with other tasks when it is given too much importance.

stiffness.description:
Tasks's stiffness. Contrary to most tasks, the stiffness here is expected to be high, as the trajectory task will track small errors. It is not uncommon to use a stiffness of 1000 or more if tracking accuracy is important.
Warning: Be careful to avoid discontinuities in the trajectory (e.g while manipulating the targets from the GUI), as the high tracking stiffness could generate fast motions.

duration.description: Task's duration. Note, you may use the "timeElapsed: true" completion criteria.

paused.description: When true, start the task in a paused state (targets the current surface pose until unpaused)

displaySamples.description: Number of points to sample along the trajectory for visual display

gainsInterpolation.title: GainsInterpolation
gainsInterpolation.description: Linear interpolation parameters for the tasks's gains expressed as pairs of (time, gain). The initial gains are those specified by dimWeight, stiffness and damping unless otherwise specified.
